name: limestone production, crushed, for mill | limestone, crushed, for mill | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11115/documentation

This dataset represents the production of crushed limestone. In Quebec, crushed limestone is generally an intermediate product (not intended for sale): Limestone, crushed is a pre-product for the milling process into lime.  ;;Diesel and electricity consumption, as well as air emissions were provided by the only limetone producer in Quebec. A weighted average of their three (3) limestone plants is used. ;No water consumption in this process: limestone is crushed without washing.;;Infrastructure data was extrapolated from "limestone production, crushed, GLO 2002" ecoinvent dataset:The value of the infrastructure is normalized with a annual production capacity of about 195'000 tons of product per year. The estimated lifespan of the machines is 25 years.

From limestone unprocessesd

This activity ends with the limestone, crushed, for mill. In Quebec, this product is used onsite to produce pulverized limestone (see "lime, milled, loose" dataset). Not used to produce quicklime.

This dataset includes the processes: primary crushing, and onsite material transportation by conveyor belts and building machines. One part of the total heating energy for "production" and "administration" is included. Equipment included in the infrastructure: 1 crusher, 1 sieve and 1 small silo.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Cement & Concrete

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Quebec data are from the only company that produces limestone on the territory. Unavalable data were extrapolated based on the GLO dataset exchanges.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Heavy machines (excl. building machines) are operated electrically.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
A weighted average of the three limestone production plants in Quebec was used.
When no information available, GLO exchanges have been used as proxy for Quebec. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
 
See Geography and Technolgy fields for details.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Information provided by the only Quebec producer
